[#Overview]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:300402]
Get More Brain gives you many tools to set up a unique learning environment. The focus is on communication and collaboration as well as flexible, interactive learning content. Let’s get an overview over all features. Follow the links to learn more about working with our tools.

[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:299119]
[%][%About your Contacts]
The learning experience of Get More Brain is based on communication and collaboration. That’s why we’ve included a ==messenger==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/messenger/| that allows you to communicate with your personal learning network.

In the contact list in the dashboard, you can see who is currently part of your network. You can add new contacts to your network, start learning dialogs with them, or block them if necessary.

bit.body:
The learning experience of Get More Brain is based on communication and collaboration. That’s why we’ve included a ==messenger==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/messenger/| that allows you to communicate with your personal learning network.

In the contact list in the dashboard, you can see who is currently part of your network. You can add new contacts to your network, start learning dialogs with them, or block them if necessary.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&video-link]
[@id:299120]
[&video-link:https://youtu.be/ndCye7nA5pU][@caption:To start a new dialog with a contact, your invitation has to be accepted.]

videoLink.caption: To start a new dialog with a contact, your invitation has to be accepted.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:299121]
[%][%Add contacts]
To add a contact you need to know the email-address of the person

•1 Tap the Plus icon at the bottom of the contact list
•1 Insert the email address of the new contact in the “Connect to …”-Dialog
•1 Tap “OK” to invite your new contact to Get More Brain.

Your new contact will get a message to join a conversation with you. He or she has to accept the invitation to start the conversation. If the person is not yet registered to Get More Brain, he or she will receive a link to sign up to the platform and reply to your invitation.

bit.body:
To add a contact you need to know the email-address of the person

•1 Tap the Plus icon at the bottom of the contact list
•1 Insert the email address of the new contact in the “Connect to …”-Dialog
•1 Tap “OK” to invite your new contact to Get More Brain.

Your new contact will get a message to join a conversation with you. He or she has to accept the invitation to start the conversation. If the person is not yet registered to Get More Brain, he or she will receive a link to sign up to the platform and reply to your invitation.

[%][%Delete contacts]
You cannot delete contacts in Get More Brain. However, you can block contacts.

•1 Choose a contact from the list to display the conversation
•1 Click / tap the dot menu in the top-right corner
•1 Choose “Block user”
•1 Additionally, you can delete a whole chat / conversation

•1 Choose a contact from the list to display the conversation
•1 Click / tap the dot menu in the top-right corner
•1 Choose “Block user”
•1 Additionally, you can delete a whole chat / conversation

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:299132]
[%][%About the Messenger]
The Messenger is the most important part of Get More Brain. In all learning processes, it is important for people to talk to each other. Coaches talk to learners. Learners talk to other learners. Learners talk to experts. All this happens in the Messenger.

The Messenger in Get More Brain is like every Messenger, but it is especially useful for sharing content and collaborating in learning processes. You can easily include learning content in your conversations, whether you are sending articles, quiz questions, or photos and videos.

With the Messenger in Get More Brain, you can make your learning process more efficient and productive.

bit.body:
The Messenger is the most important part of Get More Brain. In all learning processes, it is important for people to talk to each other. Coaches talk to learners. Learners talk to other learners. Learners talk to experts. All this happens in the Messenger.

The Messenger in Get More Brain is like every Messenger, but it is especially useful for sharing content and collaborating in learning processes. You can easily include learning content in your conversations, whether you are sending articles, quiz questions, or photos and videos.

With the Messenger in Get More Brain, you can make your learning process more efficient and productive.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:299133]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/gmb/manual/web-resources/images/gmb_book_7.png]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:299134]
[%][%Share Learning Content]
The Messenger in Get More Brain is made for learning: that’s why you can easily share any learning content from your library or notebooks. Send texts, images, videos or quizzes to your learning partners. They can view and edit the content directly in the Messenger. Solve quizzes directly in the chat and send back the answers. This keeps the learning conversation flowing.

bit.body: The Messenger in Get More Brain is made for learning: that’s why you can easily share any learning content from your library or notebooks. Send texts, images, videos or quizzes to your learning partners. They can view and edit the content directly in the Messenger. Solve quizzes directly in the chat and send back the answers. This keeps the learning conversation flowing.

[&video-link:https://youtu.be/TA_PAZ7KBzQ][@caption:Share Learning Content with others]

•1 Go to a title in your library and navigate to a bit you want to share
•1 Click / tap on the dot menu and choose ‘Send’.
•1 Choose a contact from your list
•1 Click / tab ‘Send’

The content bit will be listed in your conversation.

bit.body:
•1 Go to a title in your library and navigate to a bit you want to share
•1 Click / tap on the dot menu and choose ‘Send’.

The content bit will be listed in your conversation.

[##Enrich your messages]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:299138]
[%][%Send links with previews]
When you enter a URL into a message, it’s worth waiting a second after pasting the link. Get More Brain will fetch a rich preview of the link and embed it in the message you send to your chat buddy.

bit.body: When you enter a URL into a message, it’s worth waiting a second after pasting the link. Get More Brain will fetch a rich preview of the link and embed it in the message you send to your chat buddy.

[&video-link:https://youtu.be/u2fYB-r1Rko][@caption:Send links with rich previews]

[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:299140]
[%][%Add videos]
Videos make learning so much easier and exciting. You can easily add videos to any conversation.

•1 Click / tap on the plus symbol in the text input field
•1 Choose ‘Video
•1 Paste the URL of a video (Youtube, Vimeo, …)
•1 Use the tab key to see a preview of the video
•1 Click ‘Send’ to add the video to your conversation

Of course, you can use local videos from your device instead of online videos.

• In the Browser, choose ‘Document’ instead of ‘Video’ in the upload-menu.
• On your smartphone or tablet, use ‘Photo Library’ instead of the video-upload.

bit.body:
Videos make learning so much easier and exciting. You can easily add videos to any conversation.

•1 Click / tap on the plus symbol in the text input field
•1 Choose ‘Video
•1 Paste the URL of a video (Youtube, Vimeo, …)
•1 Use the tab key to see a preview of the video
•1 Click ‘Send’ to add the video to your conversation

Of course, you can use local videos from your device instead of online videos.

• In the Browser, choose ‘Document’ instead of ‘Video’ in the upload-menu.
• On your smartphone or tablet, use ‘Photo Library’ instead of the video-upload.

[%][%Reply]
You can reply to a message and continue the conversation at any time. It makes a difference whether you simply type a new message or use the ‘Reply’ command from the dot menu.

•1 If you reply in the text box at the bottom of the screen, the conversation continues at the top level. If you use
•1 the ‘Reply’ command, you reply specifically to the current message. This will open a new thread in the conversation, where you can discuss specifically the current topic.

[##Working with conversations]

[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:299168]
[%][%Start a conversation]
It’s super easy to start a conversation with one of your contacts.

•1 Start in your contact list and click / tap on a name.
•1 The messenger will open with the latest message of your conversation.
•1 Type a message in the text field at the bottom of the screen.

bit.body:
It’s super easy to start a conversation with one of your contacts.

•1 Start in your contact list and click / tap on a name.
•1 The messenger will open with the latest message of your conversation.
•1 Type a message in the text field at the bottom of the screen.

bitmark:
[.info:bitmark--]
[@id:299169]
You can use the dictation feature of your smartphone instead of typing your message.

bit.body: You can use the dictation feature of your smartphone instead of typing your message.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:299170]
[%][%Browse the history]
If you have a conversation open in Messenger, you will see all past messages by scrolling up and down.

•1 By default, you see the latest message at the bottom of the conversation.
•1 Scroll / swipe up and down to see more messages.
•1 Look out for the time stamps on every message.

bit.body:
If you have a conversation open in Messenger, you will see all past messages by scrolling up and down.

•1 By default, you see the latest message at the bottom of the conversation.
•1 Scroll / swipe up and down to see more messages.
•1 Look out for the time stamps on every message.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:299171]
[%][%Reading status]
Do you want to know whether the other person has already read a message or not? Just check the status on each message. The timestamp shows you the chronology of all messages.

[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:299196]
[%][%The Power of Bits]
Learning content in Get More Brain has a special feature: all content is built from so-called Bits.

You can use these individual Bits for learning. You can copy them into a notebook and add your personal notes. You can also share the Bits with your ==contacts==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/contacts/| and work together on the Bits in the ==Messenger==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/messenger/|.

If you download a title from the ==Academy==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/academy/| and read it in the ==Library==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/library/|, you can use individual text passages, images, videos or quizzes as Bits.

If you copy a Bit to a notebook, you can add your own content and notes to it. These notes are also saved as Bits, so you can share your content with others as well.

bit.body:
Learning content in Get More Brain has a special feature: all content is built from so-called Bits.

You can use these individual Bits for learning. You can copy them into a notebook and add your personal notes. You can also share the Bits with your ==contacts==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/contacts/| and work together on the Bits in the ==Messenger==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/messenger/|.

If you download a title from the ==Academy==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/academy/| and read it in the ==Library==|link:https://stage-gmb.wordpressmacher.ch/howto/library/|, you can use individual text passages, images, videos or quizzes as Bits.

If you copy a Bit to a notebook, you can add your own content and notes to it. These notes are also saved as Bits, so you can share your content with others as well.

[%][%Use the label-menu for quick options]
When you add a notes-bit to your notebook, a colored area appears where you can paste text. As soon as you start writing, you’ll see a text-label on the right of the current section. Click on the label to change the function of the section. Every section can be:

• a **title** to start a new note.
• a **subtitle** to further organize the note.
• a simple **text** to write down your ideas.

As a fourth option in the label-menu, you can delete the section.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:299217]
• **Add to basket:** the basket helps you collect multiple Bits. Think of it as an internal clipboard. In the Messenger, you can send all Bits of your current basket to one of your contacts. Or you can drop all Bits of your Basket in any notebook.
• **Send…:** sends the current bit to one of your contacts
• **Save to another Notebook…:** this creates a copy of the current bit and drops it in another notebook. You can select an existing notebook or create a new one on the fly.
• **Add Bookmark:** add a bookmark to get back to the current Bit.
• **Add Favorite:** mark the current Bit as a Favorite.
• **Add Note:** add a comment to the current Bit.
• **Add Scribble:** add a handwritten note to the current Bit
• **Copy:** copy the current Bit to the clipboard to paste it on another location
• **Cut:** cut the current Bit to the clipboard to paste it on another location
• **Copy Link to this Bit:** instead of copying the Bit you can copy the link to the current bit. Send this link to anybody in an email, a message, a Social Media-Post or a Slack-Notification. Anybody who knows the link can access your current Bit in Get More Brain.
• **Delete:** delete the current Bit

bit.body:
• **Add to basket:** the basket helps you collect multiple Bits. Think of it as an internal clipboard. In the Messenger, you can send all Bits of your current basket to one of your contacts. Or you can drop all Bits of your Basket in any notebook.
• **Send…:** sends the current bit to one of your contacts
• **Save to another Notebook…:** this creates a copy of the current bit and drops it in another notebook. You can select an existing notebook or create a new one on the fly.
• **Add Bookmark:** add a bookmark to get back to the current Bit.
• **Add Favorite:** mark the current Bit as a Favorite.
• **Add Note:** add a comment to the current Bit.
• **Add Scribble:** add a handwritten note to the current Bit
• **Copy:** copy the current Bit to the clipboard to paste it on another location
• **Cut:** cut the current Bit to the clipboard to paste it on another location
• **Copy Link to this Bit:** instead of copying the Bit you can copy the link to the current bit. Send this link to anybody in an email, a message, a Social Media-Post or a Slack-Notification. Anybody who knows the link can access your current Bit in Get More Brain.
• **Delete:** delete the current Bit

[@id:299218]
[%][%Upload PDFs]
While you can add your personal notes Bit by Bit, uploading a PDF is a good starting point to continue the work on a notebook. Create a PDF from an existing content and create a new notebook with it.

Generate and upload PDFs from:

• Text documents: Microsoft Word, Google Docs, Pages, …
• Slideshows: Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Slides, Keynote, …
• Graphics: Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, …
• InDesign, Affinity Designer, …
• Notion, Obsidian, Roam, OneNote, …
• Webpages
• Emails, Messages
• Slack-Conversations
• …

Just drop a PDF on the “Upload PDF”-field or click / tap on the field to choose a PDF from your device. Get More Brain converts the PDF into a new Bit-based notebook, which you can enrich with your own notes and other Bits.

bit.body:
While you can add your personal notes Bit by Bit, uploading a PDF is a good starting point to continue the work on a notebook. Create a PDF from an existing content and create a new notebook with it.

Generate and upload PDFs from:

• Text documents: Microsoft Word, Google Docs, Pages, …
• Slideshows: Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Slides, Keynote, …
• Graphics: Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, …
• InDesign, Affinity Designer, …
• Notion, Obsidian, Roam, OneNote, …
• Webpages
• Emails, Messages
• Slack-Conversations
• …

Just drop a PDF on the “Upload PDF”-field or click / tap on the field to choose a PDF from your device. Get More Brain converts the PDF into a new Bit-based notebook, which you can enrich with your own notes and other Bits.

[@id:299237]
[%][%Sharing Content: What this means for your learning]
In Get More Brain, you can share content with others. You can also copy individual content to your notebook and add your own content there. This sounds obvious, but it’s not!

When you read a printed book while learning, you don’t have this option. If you want to share content with someone, you have to re-write it or scan it by taking a picture. Even if the book is available as an e‑book, it is often difficult to copy individual elements of the content from the e‑book and use them in another app.

In Get More Brain, sharing content is explicitly allowed. For us, it is the core of learning that you continue to work with content, discuss it with others, add your own thoughts and ideas to it. That’s why the content in Get More Brain is modular. You don’t have to copy an entire chapter. You can use and work with individual passages, images, videos or quizzes.

bit.body:
In Get More Brain, you can share content with others. You can also copy individual content to your notebook and add your own content there. This sounds obvious, but it’s not!

When you read a printed book while learning, you don’t have this option. If you want to share content with someone, you have to re-write it or scan it by taking a picture. Even if the book is available as an e‑book, it is often difficult to copy individual elements of the content from the e‑book and use them in another app.

In Get More Brain, sharing content is explicitly allowed. For us, it is the core of learning that you continue to work with content, discuss it with others, add your own thoughts and ideas to it. That’s why the content in Get More Brain is modular. You don’t have to copy an entire chapter. You can use and work with individual passages, images, videos or quizzes.
bit.lead: Sharing Content: What this means for your learning

[%][%Sharing single Bits]
All learning content in Get More Brain is very modular. You can share individual sections, images, videos or quizzes with your learning partners or save them in your personal notebooks. There you can add your own content or make detailed notes.

To work with a single content bit, click on the small black dot at the top right of each module. A context menu opens, which offers you different possibilities.

•1 Go to the Dot Menu of a Bit
•1 Choose ‘Send’ or ‘Save to Notebook’
•1 Choose a Contact or a Notebook to send the bit to

[@id:299241]
The dot menu of every bit gives you multiple options to work with a bit:
• **Add to Basket:** Collect multiple Bits to a Clipboard / Basket and use them in you Notebook or in the Messenger
• **Send…:** Send a single Bit to one of your contacts.
• **Save to Notebook…:** Save a single Bit to one of your notebooks.
• **Add Bookmark:** Add a Bookmark to easily find the Bit again later.
• **Add Favorite:** Add a Favorite to mark important Bits.
• **Add Note:** Add a Note to annotate a bit.
• **Add Scribble:** Add a freeform scribble to the bit
• **Copy:** Copy a single Bit to use it elsewhere.
• **Copy Link to this Bit:** Copy the link to a single Bit to use it elsewhere.

If you want to send not just one bit, but several to one of your contacts or transfer them to a notebook, Get More Brain has a handy feature for that: the Basket.

•1 Go to the Dot Menu of a Bit
•1 Choose ‘Add to Basket’
•1 Go to another Bit and repeat the steps

This way you can store as many individual Bits as you like in the basket, a kind of clipboard. The Bits are saved one after the other. You can also merge Bits from different learning contents in the basket.

[%][%About the Academy]
The Academy is the place where you will find learning content that will guide you on the path to your learning goals. Think of the Academy as a marketplace where authors, trainers, and publishers can post their content. All content uses Bitmark format, so it is modular and optimized for use in Get More Brains Messenger or notebooks. In the Academy you will find both free learning content and content that you can purchase with your credit card.

[%][%Login-Screen]
Using Get More Brain is fast, easy and secure: You just have to provide a valid email-address and a secure password to get Access to the best learning experience.

Since Get More Brain is a lifelong learning experience, it is recommended to use a private mail address for login. This ensures that you can access Get More Brain even if you change employers.

To make logging in even easier, you can use an existing account on Google, Apple, or Facebook.

To make logging in even easier, you can use an existing account on Google, Apple, or Facebook.

[@id:299288]
[%][%Register]
If you use Get More Brain for the first time, you need to register with your email address and a secure password. We recommend using a private email address. This way, you will have access to your learning materials for life, even if you change employers.

bit.body: If you use Get More Brain for the first time, you need to register with your email address and a secure password. We recommend using a private email address. This way, you will have access to your learning materials for life, even if you change employers.

bitmark:
[.warning:bitmark++]
[@id:299289]
Use a strong password to access your account. A strong password is at least 12 characters long but 14 or more is better. Use a combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols. Don’t use a word that can be found in a dictionary or the name of a person, character, product, or organization. Make your new password significantly different from your previous passwords.

•1 Click / Tap on “Register” to create a new personal Profile
•1 Enter a private email address to register to Get More Brain.
•1 Alternatively, you can sign in with any existing Facebook‑, Google- or Apple-Account.
•1 Enter a strong password. (You can show it to be sure about what you enter)
•1 Provide your first and last name and choose your country to make your profile a bit more personal.
•1 Click / Tap “Register” to continue.

After your registration, we will email you a confirmation-link to the provided email address. Check your spam-folder if our mail does not appear withing a few minutes. In our mail you will see a link with which you can confirm your registration. Click / Tap on the link and your Registration is done.

From now on, you can log into Get More Brain.

Make your new password significantly different from your previous passwords.

•1 Alternatively, you can sign in with any existing Facebook‑, Google- or Apple-Account.
•1 Enter a strong password. (You can show it to be sure about what you enter)
•1 Provide your first and last name and choose your country to make your profile a bit more personal.
•1 Click / Tap “Register” to continue.

After your registration, we will email you a confirmation-link to the provided email address. Check your spam-folder if our mail does not appear withing a few minutes. In our mail you will see a link with which you can confirm your registration. Click / Tap on the link and your Registration is done.

From now on, you can log into Get More Brain.

[@id:299302]
[▼ch-21]
[##Business Profiles]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:299303]
If you use Get More Brain in an organization, you may get a login through your company’s single-login system. In this case, you can also add a private email address to your profile, which you can use to log in to Get More Brain if you leave the company.

This way, your learning content and notebooks remain accessible for a lifetime.

If you use Get More Brain in an organization, you may get a login through your company’s single-login system. In this case, you can also add a private email address to your profile, which you can use to log in to Get More Brain if you leave the company.

This way, your learning content and notebooks remain accessible for a lifetime.
